verse.verse_0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
verse.verse_3: And the even and the odd.
verse.verse_4: And the night as it recedes.
verse.verse_5: Is there in this an oath for a rational person?
verse.verse_6: Have you not seen how your Lord dealt with Aad?
verse.verse_8: The like of which was never created in the land.
verse.verse_9: And Thamood-those who carved the rocks in the valley.
verse.verse_11: Those who committed excesses in the lands.
verse.verse_13: So your Lord poured down upon them a scourge of punishment.
verse.verse_14: Your Lord is on the lookout.
verse.verse_15: As for man, whenever his Lord tests him, and honors him, and prospers him, he says, "My Lord has honored me."
verse.verse_16: But whenever He tests him, and restricts his livelihood for him, he says, "My Lord has insulted me."
verse.verse_17: Not at all. But you do not honor the orphan.
verse.verse_18: And you do not urge the feeding of the poor.
verse.verse_19: And you devour inheritance with all greed.
verse.verse_20: And you love wealth with immense love.
verse.verse_21: No-when the earth is leveled, pounded, and crushed.
verse.verse_22: And your Lord comes, with the angels, row after row.
verse.verse_23: And on that Day, Hell is brought forward. On that Day, man will remember, but how will remembrance avail him?
verse.verse_24: He will say, "If only I had forwarded for my life."
verse.verse_25: On that Day, none will punish as He punishes.
verse.verse_26: And none will shackle as He shackles.
verse.verse_27: But as for you, O tranquil soul.
verse.verse_28: Return to your Lord, pleased and accepted.
